title: House speaker says emergency Snap food aid funding not easy to do as millions lose benefit while shutdown drags on – US politics live
summary: Mike Johnson defended the inaction on using contingency funds to pay Snap recipients following judges' orders. As the US government shutdown approaches a record length, pressure mounts on lawmakers to find a resolution. The stalemate continues to affect vital assistance programs.

title: WTA Finals tennis: Anisimova v Keys; Rybakina beats Swiatek – live
summary: Daniel Harris will provide updates from the season-ending tournament taking place in Saudi Arabia. Stay tuned for the latest developments and highlights. Don't miss out on the exciting conclusion of the season.

title: MPs spar over response to Cambridgeshire train attack – UK politics live
summary: A Lib Dem spokesperson has accused Reform of attempting to exploit a recent incident for political advantage. They described the remarks made by the shadow home secretary as "beneath contempt." The statement reflects a firm disapproval of the political maneuvers surrounding the incident.

title: Telegraph bidder reported for potential breach of editorial independence rules
summary: The UK government has been notified following claims that RedBird Capital's CEO threatened to "go to war" with the newsroom of a prominent title. This incident raises concerns about media freedom and corporate influence. The fallout from such statements may lead to investigations and potential policy discussions.

title: Liz Barnard obituary
summary: A renowned interior designer, recognized as a 'house doctor,' has passed away, leaving behind a legacy of transforming homes and interiors. Known for her unique style and expert advice, she gained significant recognition in the design community. Her contributions to the industry made a lasting impact on homeowners seeking inspiration and guidance.
